reviews.review: the cake is there you just have to look for it
Amusing puzzle game, especially for those who secretly yearn to destroy their fault computer parts with fire. A classic!

I had Portal on the edge of my gaming interest for years without any particular reason and when I now finally got my hands on it, I just simply can not stop playing it. It is so smart and also in the AI sarcasm so funny, I just love it!!!
This Is The Game That Was Soooooo Good It Was Made Into A Sequel It Is Amazing Especially For A Cheap Price. The Graphics May Not Be The Best But Its Not Always About The Graphics
A simple yet well made 3D puzzle game.

Aperture Laboratories Signature Red Velvet Cake Recipe:

Ingredients:

Nonstick spray
5 1/2 ounces all-purpose flour
4 ounces cake flour
1/2 ounce natural cocoa
1 teaspoon baking soda
1/2 teaspoon kosher salt
1 cup low-fat buttermilk, room temperature
1 fluid ounce red liquid food coloring
1 tablespoon white vinegar
1 teaspoon vanilla extract
10 1/2 ounces dark brown sugar
4 ounces unsalted butter, room temperature
2 whole eggs, room temperature
1 freshly reaped human soul

Baking Process:

Prepare two nine-inch baking pans by spraying them evenly with nonstick spray before baking. Next, divide the batter evenly between the prepared pans and bake until the cake springs back when pressed or reaches an internal temperature of 205 degrees F, 30 to 35 minutes. Cool in the pans on a rack for 10 minutes, and then remove the cake from the pans and cool completely, about 1 hour, before frosting.

Frosting Process:

Combine the cream cheese and butter on medium speed, just until blended, in the bowl of a stand mixer fitted with the paddle attachment. Stop and scrape down the sides of the bowl. Add the vanilla and salt and beat until combined. With the speed on low, add the powdered sugar in 4 batches, beating until smooth between each addition. Refrigerate for 5 to 10 minutes before using.



Enjoy :)
If you haven't played this game, then you suck monkey balls.
Short, but definitely worth it. Very puzzle-y and exciting.
I just completed portal and i say it was a good and emotional game.

It's one of the most well-done puzzle games ever made. A perfect learning curve, well-done environments, and some of the funniest dialogue to ever grace a video game. The only complaint you could possible have is it's length, but to me it's the absolute perfect length to hook you without overstaying its welcome or veering into filler content. It's just fantastically well-made in basically every way.
im in agreement with this form of entertainment we call "video games"
The portal franchise has one of the best stories of any game games I have ever played.

Played 2 hours huh... I guess that means this game can be beaten in 2 hours :D still worth it, its wonderful game. Essentially it's a puzzler you get a gun that allows you to create portals, entry and exit portals. Also cake is a lie!
Too worthy. I played it untill the end, twice.

The story and designs are simple but unique. I enjoyed the advanced and challenge chambers. Even if you're not one for puzzle games, I would still recommend giving it a go. 
The only thing I didn‚Äôt like was that it wasn‚Äôt long enough. I was enjoying it so much I was able to play the entire campaign in an afternoon.

Incredible game, must play. One of the best games ever made.

Sometimes it's confusing because if you don't remember or notice something you can get easily stuck, but it's your fault than the game's fault.

Short fun puzzle game. Got it on sale for less then a dollar, I recommend it at that price for sure. I beat the game in about 2 and a half hours. It's fun, but not that much longevity, still though I recommend it! It goes on sale often, so if I was you I would wait for that rather then buy it full price.
Really fun puzzles and an interesting end boss. A must play.
It's a must play for everyone. The teleportation mechanics are amazing and the challenges very fun.

I prefer this over the second one. Portal 2 doesn't waste time hiding what kind of game it is and even though it's a longer, larger and more polished game, the novelty of the concept had faded away a bit after playing this game. Like many others who played this game when it game out, I was completely surprised and amazed when the credits started rolling. If you go into this game blind, it seems like a storyless puzzle game at first and then very slowly reveals it's world to you. There's true joy in solving the puzzles, since they require you to think of the space you're in in a new way. Also there's a cake in the end.
